definition[1]: a piece of electrical equipment that receives radio or television signals and sends them on
definition[2]: to pass a message from one person or place to another
example[1]: He quickly relayed this news to the other members of staff.
definition[3]: if radio or television signals are relayed, they are received and sent, especially so that they can be heard on the radio or seen on television
example[2]: The broadcasts were relayed by satellite.
definition[4]: to lay something on the ground again because it was not done well enough before
example[3]: The carpet will have to be relaid.
